. @ miniver I've never quite gotten to the bottom of whether it's possible to refuel a running contract in Ethereum. Gas is a bit mysterious.
. @ miniver I believe the gas costs in Ethereum prevent contracts infinite looping. Although... profitable contract might refuel itself maybe
. @ miniver What saves Ethereum is that there are no infinite loops or infinite recursions to model. Keeps things tractable re Godel & Turing.
. @ miniver Unfortunately this runs head long into Godel's theorem *unless* the contracts (like # Ethereum) aren't fully Turing complete.
Now, the problem. This just sort of sits there in my mind like a UFO. Alongside the pandemic flu plan, database cryptography, poverty cures.
